title: Books on typeface design
content:
Hi,

I’m a graphic designer and i’m looking for books to start with on typeface design.  
I looked in the wiki but couldn’t get a clear idea. I’m looking for a book with information on how to start drawing type/typeface; something for beginners.

Any suggestions more than welcome...

Thanks. Marco

 [‹ Text Illustration Sites](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203172805/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38690 "Go to previous forum topic") [Alternative to Proforma ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203172805/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38456 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Marco

comments.content:
I knew there was something like this around here,  
Thanks so much, Simon.

\> Leslie Cabarga’s book Learn FontLab Fast is essential if you are using FontLab, and his Logo, Font and Lettering Bible is also very informative. (from the referred thread).

I have to vouch for these books. I just got them, and recently finished reading the latter, and have browsed the former extensively. They are absolutely the best resources I have seen for beginning type design. (Note: they expect you to have mastered Illustrator or another vector program first).

Thanks again,  
Just ordered both books. They seem like a perfect start.  
Already have Bringhurst offcourse.

Don’t forget Typophile’s very own How To section...

[http://typophile.com/node/12369](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203172805/http:/typophile.com/node/12369 "http://typophile.com/node/12369")

...or these online resources:

[http://briem.ismennt.is/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203172805/http:/briem.ismennt.is/ "http://briem.ismennt.is/")

Cheers,  
R.
